thread.title: Shake Shack shares fall after secondary offering
thread.title_full: Shake Shack shares fall after secondary offering - MarketWatch

author: By     Claudia Assis
title: Shake Shack shares fall after secondary offering
text: Shares of Shake Shack Inc. SHAK, +3.49% fell 4% in after-hours trading Monday after news that a few of the burger chain's shareholders are offering 4 million shares of Class A common stock for sale, according to a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The company said it was not selling shares nor it will receive any proceeds from the sale by the selling shareholders. Sellers include Green Equity Investors VI, LP SEG Partners LP, and company executives such as Chief Executive Randy Garutti and Chief Financial Officer Jeff Uttz as well as board of directors chairman Danny Meyer.
